abstract: In 1987, Time magazine calculated that "of the 170 countries that exist today, more than 160 have written charters modeled directly or indirectly on the U.S. version." But the Constitution appears to be losing its appeal as a model, writes our colleague Adam Liptak. And in Egypt last week, Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg said, "I would not look to the United States Constitution if I were drafting a constitution in the year 2012." Read the full article, hundreds of comments and leave your own»
